The universal postal union is warning American consumers will pay a heavy price if the Trump Administration goes ahead with its threat to pull out of an international postal treaty
As Lisa slime reports from Geneva Washington claims the treaty benefits China at the expense of American business interests
Trump Administration wants to renegotiate the treaty saying it allows China to males small packages to America at heavily discounted rate making it hard for American business to compete as senior postal union official warns Americans won't be able to send international letters or international packets
In business to compete as senior postal union official warns Americans won't be able to send international letters or international packages if Washington pulls out of the one hundred forty four year old treaty he
Says the U.S won't be able to access special codes needed to send and receive mail internationally and this will affect UPS that ... and other companies who also would lose access to these codes for NPR News I'm Lisa shrine in Geneva
President Trump is wrapping up three days of mid term elections stumping for GOP candidates in next month's elections
With a rally in El Paso Nevada today the president has been trying to motivate voter turnout using reports of a caravan of Honduran and Guatemalan migrants heading toward the U.S border
The procession has shrunk from an estimated three thousand people to about one thousand and most are now held up at the Guatemala
Mexico border I'm Barbara Klein NPR News in Washington
